Reverse strings in JavaScript

25 April 2013

  • JavaScript

Today a simple way to reverse string in JavaScript.

var reversed
  , name = "Mariz Melo";
	
reversed = name.split("").reverse().join("");
alert(reversed);

That is it. What just happened?

Well we used the JavaScript split method to convert our string into an Array of words. After that we used the reversed method to reverse the order of those words in our newly created Array. Finally, we used the method join to convert the Array into a string again (now with the words in reverse order).

Simple like this.
